intro: Cyclophorus, commonly known as the cyclophorus plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and showy, often colorful flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Cyclophorus species are often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments within forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
